Title: Donald Edmond Pelotte
Content: donald e. pelotte ss april 13 1945 – january 7 2010 american prelate abenaki descent roman catholic church served third bishop diocese gallup new mexico 1986 2008. pelotte first native american appointed catholic bishop united state donald pelotte born april 13 1945 waterville maine norris albert pelotte margaret yvonne labrie pelotte father abenaki mother french-canadian descent february 24 1986 pope john paul ii named pelotte coadjutor bishop diocese gallup consecrated may 6 1986 archbishop robert fortune sanchez upon retirement jerome j. hastrich bishop gallup march 31 1990 pelotte automatically replaced 1986 2008 pelotte also served episcopal moderator tekakwitha conference association native american first nation catholic 10 1992 pelotte walked tekawitha annual meeting response dissident group within conference accused catholic church ignoring native american ritual pelotte also known roman catholic bishop ordained twin brother pelotte ordained father dana f. pelotte priesthood september 4 1999 waterville 11 july 23 2007 pelotte suffered traumatic brain injury gallup home according chancery official police report pelotte said fell stair hospitalized john c. lincoln hospital phoenix arizona spending time intensive care unit 12 january 3 2008 pope benedict xvi appointed thomas j. olmsted bishop phoenix apostolic administrator sede plenum diocese gallup Title: Hugues Alexandre Joseph Meunier
Content: hugues alexandre joseph meunier 23 november 1758 1751 – 9 december 1831 french army general french revolutionary war napoleonic war born mont-louis mercenary general hugues meunier became cadet lyonnais regiment 30 june 1768 aged nine rank sub-lieutenant promoted lieutenant 1774 captain 1782 regiment fought naval campaign 1779 1783 command charles-gustave de falkenhayn including service siege mahon gibraltar made chevalier de saint-louis long service 1791 lieutenant-colonel 34th line infantry regiment 5 february 1792. thus served army north general gilbert du motier de la fayette charles-françois dumouriez commanding 1st grenadier battalion reserve 1 august 15 september 1792. role converged guarantee armée du grand-pré 's safe retreat sainte-menehould bringing position 's artillery enemy fire beat several prussian attack entrance senuc wood however taking battalion squadron chamborand support attacked seven enemy squadron protected light artillery badly wounded arm sabre wishing reward service commander chief made colonel field battle ranking regiment 24th previous month date vacancy appeared rank colonel pierre riel de beurnonville general minister war also showed government 's appreciation sending fully equipped horse recovering wound meunier returned army north acted brigadier general commanded man defence line pont-à-marcq mons-en-pévèle given force 8,000 men next commanded citadel lille city threatened enemy – organised eight newly raised battalion result recruiting moved vendée command 1st battalion 34th line infantry regiment fought quiberon expedition made brigadier general commander chief lazare hoche field battle 16 july 1795 – rank confirmed 23 august later 1795 put command one division army coast brest later known army coast ocean soon hoche louis thomas villaret de joyeuse laurent truguet put command planned expedition capture cape good hope though never came fruition hoche ordered meunier raise 17,000 men second half planned expédition d'irlande put meunier command hoche invasion force set ireland 15 december 1796 reached open sea frigate carrying general separated main force storm ship dispersed headed back brest september 1797 meunier assigned armée d'angleterre planned invasion united kingdom – commander napoleon bonaparte 13 april 1798 put military committee 16 october 1798 made head dépôt de la guerre 2 december 1799 took command finistère already exercised actively put brest war footing sending memo topic napoleon first consul commander-in-chief guillaume marie-anne brune praised meunier report government successor role general frédéric-christophe houdelot – time handover led operation forced george cadoudal surrender year x 1801–1802 meunier moved 12th military division made member légion d'honneur 11 december 1803 commander order 14 june 1804. 29 april made member commission set write military code dissolved completing work meunier attached section charged editing ordnance infantry manoeuvre – completed work presented government 1806 made part grande armée coming paris wait order 21 september 1807. retired 23 november 1807 succeeded régis barthélemy mouton-duvernet inspector several line infantry artillery regiment 26 december 1807. granted land westphalia title baron de l'empire napoleon 19 march 1808 date also made inspector infantry 21st military division 30 april later commander méditerranée department tuscany meunier briefly retired health reason 14 october 1809 otherwise remained position 21 june 1810 put charge branch hôtel de invalides louvain 1 july 1812 30 july 1814 charge école militaire de saint-cyr 10 august 1814 promoted lieutenant general 16 august 1814 made chevalier de saint-louis 22 september 1814 commander vienne department 12th military division commanded 17 february 1815. decree 30 march 1815 made commander école militaire de la flèche finally retired 1 august year died poitier 1831 french évolutions par brigade ou instruction servant de développement aux manœuvres de ligne indiquées dans le règlements ouvrage dédié au duc de berri paris 1814 in-8° avec 16 planches

Title: LFG Roland D.III
Content: lfg roland d.iii fighter aircraft produced germany world war i. d.iii development d.i fighter machine fuselage completely filled interplane gap design feature intended improve aerodynamics however also resulted limiting pilot 's field vision forward direction leading complaint lfg attempted remedy d.iii design introducing gap upper fuselage upper wing braced cabane strut size tailplane also increased indeed result improvement roland d.ii preceded performance d.iii inferior contemporary fighter available german army particular produced albatros aircraft therefore produced small quantity forward visibility though better d.iii d.i still good lfg tried improve another variant d.v fuselage diameter decreased decking forward cockpit lowered exposing upper part engine cylinder three built one argus engine d.ii two 119 kw 160 hp mercedes d.iii another upright 6-cylinder engine visibility much improved problem solved lfg roland d.vii used v-8 engine general characteristic performance armament bulgarian air force luftstreitkrafte crew one pilot length 6.84 22 ft 5 wingspan 8.94 29 ft 4 height 2.76 9 ft 1 wing area 19.8 m2 213 sq ft empty weight 717 kg 1,580 lb gross weight 961 kg 2,119 lb powerplant 1 × argus as.iii 6-cylinder inline water-cooled 134 kw 180 hp maximum speed 175 km/h 109 mph 95 kn cruise speed 156 km/h 98 mph 85 kn endurance 2 hour 30 minute service ceiling 4,500 14,800 ft rate climb 4.5 m/s 880 ft/min 2 × fixed forward-firing 7.92 mm lmg 08/15 machine gun

Title: Frederick Maddison (footballer)
Content: frederick brunning maddison 22 july 1849 – 25 september 1907 english footballer played england midfielder first international match scotland well winning two fa cup medal oxford university 1874 wanderer 1876. later music publisher together wife composer adela maddison closely associated french composer gabriel fauré born 22 july 1849 westminster middlesex frederick chappell son frederick patey chappell eleanor née maddison 5 february 1873 changed name frederick brunning maddison taking second name grandfather educated marlborough college going oxford university member brasenose college played scotland third unofficial match prior first official international match 1–1 draw 25 february 1871 playing pseudonym f. maclean solitary england cap playing left midfield england 's first ever international match scotland 30 november 1872. university reached 1874 fa cup final maddison right time successful defeating royal engineer two goal nil maddison involved move resulted second goal together cuthbert ottaway robert vidal dribbled way engineer goal frederick patton waiting slide ball post maddison also played amateur club crystal palace later professional club civil service representative match london south versus north 14 april 1883 married katharine mary adela tindal christ church lancaster gate london two child diana marion adela noel cecil guy born 1886 1888 respectively wife composer usually known adela maddison 10 around 1894 couple played major part encouraging facilitating entry onto london musical scene french composer gabriel fauré 11 frederick working music publishing company metzler obtained contract publish fauré 's music 1896 1901. fauré friend family 1896 vacationed residence saint-lunaire brittany 1898 maddison wife lived separately adela residing paris 10 may romantic liaison fauré frederick maddison died germany 25 september 1907 moabit hospital berlin

Title: Kansas City Masonic Temple
Content: masonic temple kansa city missouri neo-classical architecture building beaux-arts architecture tradition designed j.c. sunderland masonic cornerstone laid october 8 1910 building held public dedication ceremony september 30 1911. harry s. truman be truman danced 6,600 square foot tiffany ballroom prominently feature plaster column impressive tiffany glass window array kansa city masonic temple listed national register historic place 1980 film location missouri film commission 2013. restoration project launched 2017 restore preserve building future generation

Title: Pat Saward
Content: patrick saward 17 august 1928 – 20 september 2002 professional footballer english football league republic ireland died alzheimer 's disease 2002. playing amateur crystal palace saward joined non-league club beckenham town started senior career 1951 joined millwall professional made 118 league appearance millwall joining aston villa £10,000 summer 1955. time villa park fa cup second division championship 1960. joined huddersfield town 1961 playing 59 league game club october 1963 saward signed crawley town played international level republic ireland winning 18 cap retiring player saward joined youth team coaching staff coventry city becoming assistant manager jimmy hill club july 1970 saward appointed manager brighton & hove albion winning promotion second division 1972. october 1973 following bottom placed finish relegation back third division saward sacked replaced brian clough following spell brighton saward coached saudi arabia well managing emirati club al-nasr retiring stayed dubai health issue necessitated return united kingdom near family died september 2002 aged 74 result bronchial pneumonia

Title: Leanna Brown
Content: leanna brown may 11 1935 – december 15 2016 american politician served house new jersey legislature represented new jersey 's 26th legislative district including part morris passaic county first republican woman elected new jersey senate brown born leanna cawley young providence rhode island father partner new york brokerage firm blyth eastman dillon & co. attended northfield school girl part northfield mount hermon school gill massachusetts graduated 1952. graduated smith college 1956. married yale graduate stanley brown settled chatham new jersey initially brown spent four year writing test question educational testing service located outside princeton new jersey later became active local politics chatham serving borough council 1969 1972. 1972 elected serve morris county board chosen freeholder named freeholder director 1976 president new jersey association county 1978. 1980 brown special election unexpired term new jersey general assembly re-elected following year 1983 challenged former running-mate james p. vreeland republican nomination state senate 26th district primary philadelphia daily news described stunning upset elected state senate becoming first woman republican party serve upper house state legislature 1989 formed exploratory committee consider run governor new jersey brown ultimately decided running republican primary jim courter 1993 brown resigned state senate appointed new jersey casino control commission initially serve unexpired term charles j. irwin assemblymember robert martin chosen fill brown 's vacancy senate following year named governor christine todd whitman full five-year term commission serving 1999. brown husband founded brown global enterprise small consulting firm 2001 volunteered work transition team president george w. bush may 2007 appointed bush serve president 's commission white house fellowship graduation smith brown married william stanley brown attended mount hermon school yale university settled Title: Barrie Martin
Content: barrie martin 29 september 1935 – 27 february 2019 english professional footballer spent seven year blackpool 1950s 1960s making almost 200 football league appearance club martin made debut joe smith 's blackpool 28 december 1957 3–2 defeat bolton wanderer also appeared final league game three day later another defeat time tottenham hotspur joe smith retired 23 year blackpool manager end 1957–58 successor 1958–59 campaign former pool player ron suart suart gave six league start martin martin 's third season blackpool 1959–60 properly broke team made 38 league appearance missing four game also scored first goal club 3–1 victory chelsea bloomfield road 12 december 1960–61 martin ever-present blackpool 's first twelve game league campaign went miss next 22. returned line-up 31 march eight game remaining appeared six conversely martin missed one league game 1961–62 campaign one blackpool 's 52 total game included run semi-finals league cup went one better 1962–63 appearing club 's 47 league cup game martin chalked another forty league appearance 1963–64 final season seaside swan song final game league campaign 4–3 defeat ipswich town 25 april

Title: Haeng Ung Lee
Content: haeng ung h.u lee july 20 1936 – october 5 2000 co-founder first grand master american taekwondo association h.u lee born manchuria china 1936. world war ii family relocated south korea lee began martial art training 1953 earned first degree black belt 1954. 1956 lee entered korean army trainer special troop spent time part intelligence unit baengnyoung island three year retired opened taekwondo school osan air base met richard reed would later sponsor emigration united state 1962. lee moved omaha nebraska 1969 co-founded american taekwondo association omaha remained organization 's headquarters lee relocated little rock arkansas 1977. h.u lee developed discipline songham taekwondo 1983. 1990 ata master 's council awarded lee rank 10th degree black belt title grand master haeng ung lee active participant charity work ata provided funding towards numerous organization muscular dystrophy association susan g. komen race cure arkansas child 's hospital arkansas special olympics 1991 established h.u lee scholarship foundation provide funding towards active college student h.u lee additionally received several award work contribution including limited key city award omaha nebraska corpus christi texas little rock arkansas evansville indiana tallahassee florida panama city florida also received kaleidoscope award 1994 crystal award 1996 little rock convention visitor 's bureau lee also inducted arkansas sport hall fame october 5 2000 lee died cancer 10 buried forest hill memorial park alexander arkansas 11 3,000 people attended funeral little rock arkansas president bill clinton sent condolence little rock mayor jim dailey 12 lee 's brother soon ho later promoted 9th degree grand master h.u lee 's widow sun c. lee received late husband 's share company became new chairman board ata h.u lee posthumously promoted 10th degree black belt awarded title eternal grand master first ever attain rank ata 2007 lee 's heir decided give tribute back lee 's home united state arranged traditional korean gate built korea shipped little rock cost $ 1.4 million gate weighs 8 ton 13 gate stand end main street bridge heart little rock arkansas representing symbol friendship south korea united state tribute martial art 14 list taekwondo grandmaster

Title: Ralph Carpenter (American football)

Title: Bill Gunn (Queensland politician, born 1895)
Content: william morrison gunn 19 april 1895 – 9 april 1970 member queensland legislative assembly gunn born mackay queensland son william gunn wife mary née mcleod educated brisbane gympie laidley joining 1st aif start world war i. stationed 2nd light horse brigade saw action gallipoli palestine april 1917 promoted sergeant month promotion gunn shot head left elbow opposing force near gaza found fractured skull put dangerously ill list deemed unfit fighting returned home may 1917. return grocer wynnum 29 october 1921 gunn married edith annie curtis died 1971 together son daughter died manly april 1970. 1944 queensland state election gunn labor party seat wynnum defeating sitting member bill dart held wynnum 22 year retiring 1966 queensland state election

Title: Black River and St. Lawrence Railway
Content: black river st. lawrence railway historic railroad new york history traced 1866 george gilbert carthage new york received charter build railroad carthage jefferson county oswegatchie river near harrisville lewis county preliminary survey began fall 1866. incorporated june 30 1868. company organized black river st. lawrence railway construction contracted row field & co. brockville ontario construction began april 29 1869 continued october resumed 1870. iron quite expensive time railroad constructed wooden rail 1882 new york state railway commission report noted railway operation original wooden rail removed locomotive 16-ton 0-4-0 w/4 wheel tender built september 1869 smith & porter locomotive work pittsburgh penna c/n 50. burned wood fancy possibly gold & white striping around red tender tank carried name pioneer side b.r. & st.l.r.r lettered fancy elongated oval panel cab window stack funnel shape tender 120 frame 112 tank 33 wheel wood rail arrived august 1869. builder photo harold k. vollrath collection company reorganized carthage adirondack railway spring 1883 mine owner jayville acquired black river st. lawrence railway planned extend rail little river st. lawrence county jayville construction extension completed 1889

Title: USS Metcalf
Content: us metcalf dd-595 fletcher-class destroyer united state navy named james metcalf served schooner us enterprise first barbary war james metcalf also spelled medcalf record boarded schooner us metcalf laid puget sound navy yard bremerton washington 10 august 1943 launched 25 september 1944 sponsored mrs. harold c. pound commissioned 18 november 1944. following shakedown san diego california metcalf assigned pacific fleet duty destroyer departed bremerton wash. 19 february 1945 carolines via pearl harbor territory hawaii arriving ulithi 16 march time join armada warship staging okinawa campaign metcalf operated escort carrier group 3. 27 march group furnished close air support landing kerama retto 26 march okinawa 1 april made raid neighboring japanese-held island 20 april period ship rescued half dozen pilot crewmembers downed carrier plane also performed radar picket screen operation metcalf departed 20th philippine via guam reporting commander 7th fleet leyte 30 april destroyer spent may june convoying fast cruiser transport assembled borneo invasion 9 june metcalf arrived brunei bay borneo 2 day patrol south china sea beginning shore bombardment support australian landing brunei bay 10th action miri-lutong south brunei bay 19 21 june reached balikpapan 27th operation task force 74 tf 74 prior main landing australian troop 1 july metcalf reported commander Title: Michael Willoughby, 11th Baron Middleton
Content: colonel michael guy percival willoughby 11th baron middleton kg mc kstj td ed 21 october 1887 – 16 november 1970 british peer soldier willoughby second son godfrey willoughby 10th baron middleton educated wellington college royal military college 1936 willoughby appointed lord lieutenant east riding yorkshire 1931 president university college hull later university hull first chancellor 1954 1970. graduating royal military college 9 october 1907 willoughby commissioned second lieutenant south lancashire regiment prince wale 's volunteer transferred 17th lancer 26 october 1907 26 october 1909 10th duke cambridge 's lancer hodson 's horse indian army promoted lieutenant 9 january 1910. willoughby stationed india outbreak first world war regiment selected go overseas march 1915 sent mesopotamia attached 16th cavalry promoted acting captain 1 june 1915 temporary captain 1 september 1915. also served 6th cavalry brigade machine gun officer january june 1916 returning 16th cavalry july 1916 attached 12th cavalry august returned india take 10th duke cambridge 's lancer hodson 's horse depot multan regiment selected active service service mesopotamia awarded military cross mentioned dispatch three time london gazette 5 april 1916 19 october 1916 12 june 1917 promoted acting captain captain 9 october 1916 later antedated 1 september 1915. multan led two scratch squadron regiment marri punitive expedition march april 1918 appointed acting major commanding depot 28 january 12 august 1918. relieved command depot august 1918. acting major whilst second command regiment 26 october 1918 11 february 1919 promoted brevet major 3 june 1919 major 9 october 1922. willoughby resigned commission 1 november 1923. elder brother killed battle jutland 1916 death father 1924 willoughby inherited barony lord middleton rose rank became associated territorial regiment east riding yorkshire first joined green howard lieutenant colonel promoted colonel 1928. commanded 5th 30th battalion east yorkshire regiment second world war 28 april 1920 lord middleton married angela florence alfreda hall daughter charles hall eddlethorpe couple four child 1957 lord middleton appointed knight garter kg death 1970 barony passed elder son digby michael godfrey john willoughby 12th baron middleton mc born 1 may 1921 died 27 may 2011 hon angela hermione ida willoughby born 5 may 1924 hon jean elizabeth mary willoughby born 26 january 1928 died 11 november 2008 married sir fergus matheson 7th baronet issue brigadier hon henry ernest christopher willoughby born 12 june 1932 died 12 july 2009

Title: Alfred Legard
Content: colonel alfred digby legard cbe 19 june 1878 – 15 august 1939 english army officer amateur first-class cricketer appeared two match marylebone cricket club mcc another four yorkshire county cricket club 1904 1910. born scarborough yorkshire england legard right-handed batsman scored 27 first-class run 9.71 best 27. right arm slow bowler bowled eleven over without success cost 33 run legard commissioned second lieutenant king 's royal rifle corp 18 may 1898 promoted lieutenant 22 october 1899. served 1st battalion regiment second boer war 1899-1902 present battle talana hill defence ladysmith early 1900 took part operation natal march–june 1900 operation transvaal east pretoria july–november 1900. received queen 's south africa medal four clasp promoted captain 14 june 1902. later served distinction world war awarded cbe colonel regiment king 's royal rifle corp died august 1939 pentire newquay cornwall legard baronet

Title: David Fasken (cricketer)
Content: david kenneth fasken 23 march 1932 – 24 may 2006 english first-class cricketer businessman fasken played first-class cricket several team 1953–1962 though played predominantly oxford university graduating university oxford became director earl court olympia exhibition centre helping become world leading exhibition venue fasken born military family batu gajah british malaya march 1932. family moved back england 1937 attended dragon school oxford attending wellington college wellington went trinity college oxford studied language debuted oxfordshire minor county cricket 1950 minor county championship studying oxford made debut first-class cricket oxford university lancashire oxford 1953. played first-class cricket oxford 1955 making 27 appearance gaining blue playing right-arm medium-fast bowler took 58 wicket university average 35.94 best figure 5 108 touring australian 1953. bat scored 403 run high score 61. addition playing first-class cricket oxford university fasken also played three match apiece marylebone cricket club 1956–59 free forester 1959–62 also played first-class level d. r. jardine 's xi l. c. stevens xi played final minor county match oxfordshire 1955. graduating oxford fasken decided take career cricketer stating life never appealed instead took career managing exhibition centre including earl court olympia vice-president retirement 1993. tenure helped olympia become one world 's leading exhibition venue also major factor development earl court two late 1980s 69 diagnosed hydrocephalus required several shunt slow progression condition spent four month hospital kidney infection shortly death returned home month died 24 may 2006 following fall stair home survived wife susan 38 year two child joanna hugh three grand-children

Title: Beaudry Leman
Content: beaudry leman january 2 1878 – 1951 canadian civil engineer politician banker third mayor shawinigan fall quebec 1902–1908 general manager banque d'hochelaga 1914–1924 general manager 1924–1933 president 1934–1947 banque canadienne nationale jean-baptiste-beaudry leman born 1878 montreal son joseph leman 1842–1885 physician polyxène beaudry 1842–1917 1895 1899 studied université catholique de lille obtained title civil engineer back montreal 1899 studied one year mcgill university obtained diploma engineer 1900 became engineer shawinigan water & power company moved shawinigan fall 1900. took part installation power plant distribution network sw & p 1902 leman elected mayor city shawinigan fall close contest winning single ballot j.a frigon leman reelected mayor 1904 1906. 1906 left shawinigan water & power company became involved construction saint maurice valley railroad 1907 left shawinigan fall resigned mayor resignation became official 1908. 1907 moved montreal involved construction work canalization hydroelectric work may 12 1908 beaudry leman married caroline béique daughter frédéric liguori béique one founder banque d'hochelaga 1912 leman entered service banque d'hochelaga initially superintendent bank 's branch 1914 appointed general manager bank 1924 banque d'hochelaga banque nationale merged form banque canadienne nationale leman became general manager merged bank held position 1933. 1933 leman became vice-president banque canadienne nationale 1934 became president bank holding position 1947. 1947 became chairman board leman appointed member several advisory committee federal government member advisory committee canalisation st. lawrence river 1931–1932 member royal commission inquire railway transportation canada 1933 member royal commission banking currency canada created bennett government three five member commission recommended creation bank canada although beaudry leman one two minority member opposed creation director Content: vernon floyd cook july 10 1927 – november 23 1987 former member ohio house representative former faculty member university akron political science department cook first director ray c. bliss institute applied politics cousin former u.s. representative robert e. cook cook born kent ohio left high school 1944 enlist united state army air corp served cryptographer 231st aaf bu stationed alamogordo new mexico england germany part operation paperclip discharge active duty cook served united state army reserve obtained rank captain reserve duty included teaching cryptographic interrogation technique fort george g. meade married sharen louise mill fort lauderdale florida cook graduated bachelor art degree ohio state university 1951. also attended miami university completed classwork required doctorate never dissertation posthumously awarded honorary ph.d. university akron 1988. cook assistant professor political science ohio wesleyan university case western reserve university becoming associate professor university akron 1965. continued position elected public office death 1987. cook first elected ohio house representative 1972. 1979 made assistant majority floor leader served finance appropriation committee ethic standard committee rule committee chair joint committee agency rule review 1987 cook made first director ray c. bliss institute applied politics university akron although cook ray c. bliss 's choice cook 's appointment controversial despite partisan wrangling cook eventually given post internship named cook provides student practical experience politics
